Rulings.Edison: ● If a monster summoned this way is later flipped face-down, it isn’t destroyed.
Rulings.Tengu: ● If a monster summoned this way is later flipped face-down, it isn’t destroyed.
Rulings.Goat:
●If one of the monsters Special Summoned by “Rescue Cat”’s effect is Set, or removed from play temporarily, the effect of “Rescue Cat” is reset and that monster is not destroyed during the End Phase.
●If your opponent controls your “Rescue Cat” and activates its effect, your opponent gets the effect and Special Summons Beast monsters from his/her Deck.
●You can activate the effect of “Rescue Cat” even if there is only 1 or zero Lv 3 or lower Beast monsters in your Deck. However, in this case you cannot Special Summon any Beast monsters for the effect of “Rescue Cat”, and your opponent gets to check your Deck to confirm.

Rulings.Cat:
● If one of the monsters Special Summoned by 'Rescue Cat'’s effect is flipped face-down, or removed from play temporarily, the effect of 'Rescue Cat' is reset and that monster isn't destroyed during the End Phase.
● If your opponent controls your 'Rescue Cat' and activates its effect, your opponent gets the effect and Special Summons Beasts from his/her Deck.
● You can't activate 'Rescue Cat's' effect if there are 1 or less LV 3 or lower Beasts in your Deck.
● Destroying the Special Summoned monsters during the End Phase does not start a Chain.

● If your opponent controls your “Rescue Cat” and activates its effect, your opponent gets the effect and Special Summons Beasts from his/her Deck.

Rulings.Stein:
● If one of the monsters Special Summoned by “Rescue Cat”’s effect is flipped face-down, or removed from play temporarily, the effect of “Rescue Cat” is reset and that monster isn't destroyed during the End Phase.
● If your opponent controls your “Rescue Cat” and activates its effect, your opponent gets the effect and Special Summons Beasts from his/her Deck.
● You can activate the effect of “Rescue Cat” even if there is only 1 or zero LV 3 or lower Beasts in your Deck. However, in this case you can't Special Summon any Beasts for the effect of “Rescue Cat”, and your opponent gets to check your Deck to confirm.
Rulings.Base:
1. If one of the monsters Special Summoned by the effect of "Rescue Cat" is flipped face-down, or removed from play temporarily, the effect of "Rescue Cat" is reset and that monster is not destroyed during the End Phase.
2. If your opponent controls your "Rescue Cat" and activates its effect, your opponent gets the effect and Special Summons Beast-Type monsters from his/her Deck.
3. You cannot activate the effect of "Rescue Cat" if there are 1 or less Level 3 or lower Beast-Type monsters in your Deck.
4. Destroying the Special Summoned monsters during the End Phase does not start a Chain.

PSCT.Edison: ① You can send this card you control to the GY; Special Summon 2 Level 3 or lower Beasts from your Deck (destroy them during the End Phase).
PSCT.Tengu:
① You can send this card you control to the GY; 
Special Summon 2 Level 3 or lower Beasts from your Deck (destroy them during the End Phase).

PSCT.Base: You can send this card to the GY; Special Summon 2 Level 3 or lower Beast monsters from your Deck, but their effects are negated, also they are destroyed during the End Phase. You can only use this effect of "Rescue Cat" once per turn.
